intro: Castela galapageia f. jervensis, commonly known as the Galapagos castela, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the Galápagos Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the Galápagos archipelago. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human disturbance.
